wSQ6OCGkgdbRY6jIu0A0nQ.text: I have been to many Italian restaurants around the world and call Veneto Trattoria Home....This is my favorite Great Staff food and wine .....

nJk_lZkZJHzXxyx2d7E4ZQ.text: Great place with amazing food and wine. We stop in every time we are in Scottsdale.  The food, wine, and atmosphere always take us back to our time in Venice. The owners are great and love to speak with the patrons , especially if you speak a little Italian

FBA7QqIuC7LRqRPVhkD7VQ.text: My wife ordered the Sea Bass and didnt care for it. The waiter took the dish back and then the owner came over to our table and berated my wife on why there was nothing wrong with the fish.  We never asked them to remove it from our bill, and they didnt. Being scolded by the establishment was not what we had in mind.   Never again for this place ever!!!!

8LHRbG2e-sibbxksfeI0AA.text: We had a wonderful dinner here.  We sat out on the patio (they need to grow their hedges another foot or so to block the parking lot and then it would be perfect).  My boyfriend got the lasagna and I got the special which was various fish including shrimp and calamari and some of the most wonderfully done crispy fresh vegetables.  Both of our meals were SMOKING HOT which I love!  The portions were a little smaller than we are accustomed to at Italian places so, next time, we will get an appetizer or salad.  It is wonderful discovering a great little restaurant so close to home and we will definitely be back.

NekAVbre0SI2J8ov5XE_QQ.text: Seven in our party.  The food was good and well-prepared, but you may not get what is on the menu.  Under "Entrees" the menu states a garden vegetable will come with each entree.  Mine did not.  The waiter explained only some come with veggies.  The cornish hen was to be deboned.  It was not.  When I asked the manager if he was aware of the menu's shortcomings, he replied,  "I make the menu, you don't like, you get out.  Go somewhere else".  We surely will.  Very rude and disrespectful.  This manager/owner waltzes around schmoozing and telling stories of Italy, but if you dare to criticize, he becomes  very short-fused.

w_L_ueE0hYPI0oKnuseKCQ.text: It's been a while since I've eaten at Veneto, but now that I live in Phoenix, I'm going to have to make this a go to for great Italian food!  The meal I had here was among the most memorable in my life!  We went here on the recommendation of the concierge at our hotel in Mesa.  When we arrived, we were a bit skeptical.  The restaurant is a bit unassuming, and considering it's tucked away in a strip mall (granted a very nice strip mall in Scottsdale), we had second thoughts.  As soon as we went inside, however, our concerns were soon allayed.  The dining room is absolutely lovely.  It is warm and inviting and very nicely done.  It makes for a reasonably romantic dining experience if you are looking for that, but it's also great for groups (and they have a great patio).  The decor is not obtrusive, and the atmosphere is very conducive to conversation.  The ambiance, plus great service, really makes Veneto a destination worth seeking from anywhere in the valley.  Of course, all the ambiance and service in the world means nothing without good food.  Fortunately, Veneto doesn't disappoint in the culinary department.  We started our meal with the Bruschetta al Salmone (bruschetta with salmon).  Bruschetta is one of my favorite appetizers (or snacks - basically a favorite all around), so it takes a lot to impress me when it comes to this dish.  Their take on this plate did not disappoint.  The flavors were bright and fresh, and the fish played nicely with the fresh tomatoes.  Absolutely wonderful bruschetta.  I was half tempted to order a second plate and just call it a meal.  Fortunately for me we avoided the temptation to eat nothing bruschetta and moved on to entrees.  I had swordfish (it was a special - not on their usual menu) and my girlfriend had the ravioli.  After being primed for a good meal by a mind blowing appetizer, we were hoping the entrees would live up to the opening act.  They did not disappoint.  I was a bit hesitant to get seafood at a restaurant in Phoenix.  Arizona is not exactly know to be a wet place, so fish in the desert seems risky.  However, considering the freshness of the salmon from our appetizer, I took the risk.  I'm glad I did.  The swordfish was, in all honesty, some of the best seafood I have ever had.  It was probably among the top five seafood dishes I have ever eaten.  Anywhere.  The fish was fresh, flakey, cooked just right, and seasoned in a way that brought out the natural goodness of the swordfish steak.  They didn't have to hide subpar fish under a wave of spices.  This was good fish, and they made it shine.  My girlfriend's pasta was also very good.  It was a nice blend of flavors, and the pasta was cooked to perfection.  For dessert, we had their take on tiramisu.  Once again I could have set myself up for disappointment because tiramisu is hands down my favorite dessert of all time, but once again, Veneto delivered.  The flavors were rich yet balanced, and the chocolate they topped it off with played nicely with the traditional mascarpone and espresso.  We also imbibed with some kind of boozy amaretto dessert coffee drink.  It, too, was delicious.  It was the prefect sweet ending to a very memorable meal.  Veneto is, quite simply, brilliant, and they provided me with one of my most memorable dining experiences ever.  I can't recommend this place enough.  Even before I moved here I was recommending it to my friends when they traveled to Phoenix.  It's a great meal in a great atmosphere, and honestly, it's a great value.  I would pay twice as much as I paid for my meal.  Seriously, try this place.  You will not be disappointed!

DWdkd2VKG4LRKi24nk2q5Q.text: I was at a business meeting at a Starbucks in Scottsdale one afternoon and I smelled something wonderful. I couldn't keep my mind on the business deal because of the aroma of some very delicious food. Whatever they were saying was not even important. I could only think where was that food smell coming from? The meeting was finally over, no doubt rushed along by me, and I walked to a little eating place a couple of doors down. I peeked in, looked at the menu, then cancelled my plans that night and came to a place that would become a favorite. I still get a little tear when I remember my first ossobuco there.   Veneto Trattoria reminds me of the small, friendly little places that I have been to in Venice where the food and the ambiance combine together for a memorable experience. I have been there many times--alone, with family, with friends, with business associates--and each time has been wonderful.   Last night, It was a little cold outside so I had the gnocci to warm me up. The plump potato dumplings tasted homemade and the meat sauce was delicious. One of my buddies had my all time favorite Veneto Trattoria dish: ossobuco. She let me taste hers and, like always, it was to die for. The veal shank and the risotto make a perfect flavor combination. Others at the table had the sausages and the pork chops. Of course I mooched a taste of those, too. Mmmm... Don't forget to have their salad with walnuts and goat cheese. It's not on the menu, but they will make it for you if you ask.  Here's a tip: become a regular. I go to Scottsdale for business several times a year and Veneto Trattoria is always on my list. Whether you travel to Scottsdale or live there, you should go to this spot whenever you can. Once you've been there twice, they will treat you like family.

SHW9uUz7-ONCxkEuXxd-jA.text: My first try to Veneto, and I'm in love with it :) Nice atmosphere, delicious food, and very nice staff. So here's a bit recap:  Antipasto: Carpaccio Affumicato (Thinly sliced cured smoked beef with shaved parmesan cheese, arugula and drizzled with balsamic, topped with a ginger-cucumber pesto) -- liked everything of this dish but not so much of the ginger pesto, the ginger taste was a bit too strong to me...  Entree: Orecchiette Salsiccia e Broccolini (Pugliese pasta sauteed with sausages and rapini, in extra virgin olive oil, garlic and red pepperoncino, slightly spicy) -- This dish was presented nicely, colorful and very flavorful! Gnocchi di Patate alla Bolognese  (Homemade potato dumpling served with homemade meat sauce) -- Loved the tasty meat sauce, and the potato dumpling was definitely one of a kind.  Dessert: Chocolate Souffle with Vanilla Ice Cream -- rich chocolate cake paired with the delish vanilla ice cream, yummmmm, what a sweet ending.

zsKirNiDb2nt76Gd0qBm1A.text: This place is the shiznit-o-bam-snip-snap-sack!  By far my favorite for Italian and for service! When the wife and I want to go out and have a great dinner and be taken awesome care of- it's a Veneto Night. We have been here dozens and dozens of times, they do a wine tasting series through the summer and we haven't missed one in the last 6 years! I can honestly say that in all of my visits here they have NEVER had an "off" night. The food is consistent, the service is the best and it is all at a completely reasonable price. Nevertheless, on to my most recent experience:   It was great! The wife and I went for dinner on our anniversary and while we love bringing our little one with us here, it was great being alone :)  We had the eggplant gratin (bomb!) and the pasta fagioli soup to start and followed those up with the gnocchi and linguini with red sauce and scallops, fish, mussels and shrimp and all I have to say is Damn! I love homemade pasta and I love it even more when it is smothered in all things good from the sea. The wife's gnocchi was great, this is the only place she will order it from. The brought us some tiramisu with a candle for our anniversary which was nice. All that plus a few glasses of wine and we didn't even hit $90.   I don't want to get into novel length here, but I cannot say enough about how great this place is. The owners are ALWAYS there, they never turn over the staff (always a good sign) and their food is consistently fantastic. I can't list everything that I have eaten here but it's a lot and it has all been good.... I even enjoyed the squid ink risotto :)  Anyway, please do yourself a favor and go here. Enjoy the people, enjoy the food and tell the world.... it's that good!

sooSuC_OZd-CNfhq_4N2UQ.text: I heart this place so much, I want to take it behind the middle school and get it pregnant.  I would give it five stars, but I'm saving a five star rating for a restaurant that lifts me off my feet.  Call me a prude.  Call me a romantic.  I don't care.  Let's start, and almost finish, with the food--it's terrific.  I've never had a bad, or mediocre, meal at this place.  I especially enjoy the gnocchi.  Sure, part of the reason I like the gnocchi is because I enjoy saying, "gnocchi."  It's just fun to say.  It's good, clean fun for the whole family.  But, aside from the tantalizing vocalization of the dish, it's really tasty.  The other dishes are great as well, but I won't bore you with a detailed description of each item.  I'm verbose, but not selfish.  Well...maybe 'not selfish' should be replaced with 'lazy' but I think you understand.  The ambiance is decent even though it's in a strip mall.  However, we live in Phoenix, so you can't really knock a place for that.  They do have some nice outdoor seating.  The owner and staff are really friendly and will talk your ear off about Italy winning the world cup--even though it happened a year and a half ago.  In summation, this place is aces...but don't tell anyone, because, as other people have written, this is a hidden gem.

gcIV43QtiNizEKYDGX4lDQ.text: What a fantastic restaurant.  I went there with a group of twelve ITALIAN people.  Every single person in our group complimented their dish.  I personally had the lasagna which was one of the best I'd ever had.  I definitely recommend this place.

vb9dKC06pKsq0aXFaENesA.text: I give this place 4 stars because is actually run by real Italians from north of Italy and its not a corporation or a chain so let's give some credit. Ive been here many times the atmosphere is actually very nice and detailed the portion are not big a maybe a little pricing for the quantity. But I'm Italian so i can judge and well the quality is actually very decent. Yesterday I had the linguine with seafood and they were just how I asked and al dente how they supposed to be. If you are on date this is a right place..pretty small...intimate ...kinda romantic also...you will look good if you bring her here and the wine list is actually very interesting and good selection. Definitely not a chep dinner but...can be worthy.

PbNy9O6ZtD3fYnEf_XqMiw.text: A hideous experience from start to finish!!  This is the second time I have been to dinner here and absolutely the last.  The first time we were taken by friends and my pasta was inedible.  The sauce was blah and I was happy I ordered a half order of eggplant or I would have starved.  The eggplant was just so-so...    We gave it another try and after being ignored for 20 minutes while the waiter pawed some 20 something in the middle of the room, he took my sister's order and left the table without asking me for mine.  He needed to rush to the bar to kiss and maul another blonde.  I guess amore' made him amnesiac as well as rude, so after another 15 mins he sent a woman over to ask us what we had ordered, as Don Juan had forgotten our order and misplaced our slip.  The place was three quarters empty and I can see why.  My eggplant was rubbery and tasted like insoles.  My sister's proschutto was okay..how do you mess up pre-sliced ham and the salad was mediocre.    As if the food were not bad enough and the service disgraceful...the waitstaff have an 'attitude' as if you should be honored that they are speaking to you at all.   CHECK!!!!!  Exit stage right.

MT8CrGFm78wM9X-YTBXMgA.text: We had a fantastic dinner AGAIN!  Gnocchi Gorgonzola, veal scallopine, pasta with clams, and filet with wine sauce.  I come from Chicago and it's still one of my top Italian restaurants anywhere.  Wine list wonderful, service is knowledgeable and efficient.  You cannot say one bad thing!   Authentic fresh delicious Italian...like me

p1Hb3iuyvea72mAn-eFa3g.text: The only thing saving this place was the bruschetta!  It was delicious, and I'm really a sucker for the stuff...   After seeing all of the good reviews, I was really excited to try this place.  We walk in late Saturday evening a couple of weeks ago without a reservation (God forbid!) and get attitude from the hostess who looked me up and down right when we walked in.  "Uhm, I think we will be able to get out you in. Do you want to sit outside?"  Anyways, we got a small, cozy table in the corner which is my favorite!  Our server was fine, nothing to complain about, but he really didn't do anything to make an impression.  I ordered lasagna, and I was really pumped for it.  But then I almost spit out the first bite! It tasted like overcooked, processed Spaghetti-O's! The pasta wasn't right, the sauce was dreadful and watery, and the spices seemed like they were only trying to cover up the horrible attempt at lasagna.  Disgusting.  My boyfriend liked his entree, but we agreed we wouldn't want to go back.  If you go, MAKE A RESERVATION and do not get the lasagna.

3Q2pksl10Pm9tI8FK7IZaw.text: Although I have been dining here for years and am sure have written a review, I feel compelled to add another after last night's New Years Eve dinner.   We usually avoid holiday dinners out as the restaurants usually cannot handle the increases numbers.   Not so here!   The food was superb, service more than acceptable and a bargain to boot!

n2ddCDL0a92xxFA-UbI2iA.text: Just have to add that I was so impressed with Veneto Trattoria that I ended up eating there three times in a two week span!  The food and the service were consistently great.  Can't wait to get back to Scottsdale!

v3J7Gb2m_2pH9sCX7Uh9Ng.text: Veneto Trattoria is out of this world! We went there for a birthday celebration. We had reservations and were seated promptly. The waiter (Matt) was very attentive without being pushy. The food was great, although we all had one of the featured specials that night. In total we spent about 3 hours at the table on a Friday night and never felt rushed. Everyone loved their food.

ZI-QFLJ5Olaiv-OsLQGR2Q.text: Went to Veneto Trattoria last Sunday for dinner on the recommendation of the concierge at the Phoenician and I wasn't disappointed. The old go-to was Voce (which was originally LeccaBaffi when we used to frequent it), but it seemed like the quality had gone down over the last couple of visits there. As critical as it sounds, I really look for Italian places that actually do their own homemade pasta as a sign of a decent place.   The wife and I celebrated our 2nd wedding anniversary here for dinner and decided to go with a couple things to share. We started with the Pasta e Fasioi which was delicious as a soup starter to share. The wife went with the Fettuccine al sugo d'anitra which was homemade fettuccine with a braised duck sauce. The dish was good, but both of us agreed that it wasn't what we expected. The duck was diced up into cubes in the sauce and we both were thinking it would have been more like a fork tender slow cooked duck sauce. I opted for the Tagliatelle con Calamari which was superb. The noodles were made and prepared to perfection and cooked al dente. The Calamari was prepared perfectly and not hard and rubbery like most preparations. We opted to share an order of the osso bucco for a main dish (Wow, we sure did have bigger eyes than our stomachs). The Osso Bucco was excellent as well and extremely tender.   For dessert, the tiramisu was creamy and topped with both a chocolate and coffee/espresso sauce that took the dish to a whole new level. Top all of that off with excellent service and a complimentary piece of homemade tiramisu for our anniversary and we have a winner of a place to come back and visit again.

d6f7Kr65-7MbnAmtg3eN-A.text: The Ossobuco was so delicious! Atmosphere is great. Went with my parents, and all we were saying during the meal was "mmm!" and "this is so good!" We will definitely go back!

-QwBe9XGY2Z5lTuLv0jiOw.text: This was our first time for dinner here and the service and food was spot on!! I had the Spaghetti alla vongole red sauce with clams and spaghetti. The clams was delicious and the sauce was perfect. Very good and tasty meal! I would definitely eat here again

wsm0ebWSSjHIgXYumo6Cxw.text: I had higher hopes for Veneto based on some of the Yelp reviews I read prior to going and it was good but definitely not great.  Again, like most of my meals on this trip, it was dinner with a big group of coworkers. By far, the dish that got the most rave reviews was the special of the day a  Dover Sole that they boned and filleted for you at the table.  But.... I didn't order that and neither did the guy next to me.  I started with a house salad with a vinaigrette that was overwhelmed by the amount of vinegar in the dressing.  For an entree, I got veal parmigiana which was two smallish pounded out pieces of veal with good tomato sauce good mozzarella on top and some overcooked squash, zucchini and carrots on the side.  It was tasty but not much veal for the price paid.  The guy next to me got the Osso Bucco and judging by how he had to hack at it with a knife, far from the fall of the bone tender you expect from a braised dish.  Based on how happy the Dover Sole crowd was with what they ordered, I'd be willing to give it another go on a subsequent trip to Scottsdale but they would need to step it up all the way around to get a third visit.

BUzaYOxxOKUJfYnNyyzKQg.text: I had dinner here with my husband last night and it was a huge disappointment!! I ordered a Ziti con Melanzane and the penne was not al dente it was undercooked and very hard to chew with a tomato sauce that was bland and absolutely tasteless. My husband's minestrone soup looked very unappetizing it came in a very small ball and was tasteless too. His calamari pasta was average. All the dishes in this restaurant are over priced and way too expensive for what u get in return. I wouldn't go back there again, our first and last visit!!

OwoehyC670pyehD-kdZx0w.text: Best ever Italtian.  Veal was not breaded and cooked just right.  Linguini was home made with lots of clams and white sauce.  Veal and ricotta ravioli with porcine sauce fabulous, again home made pasta.  Tiramisu like putting a fork in a cloud.  Meringue with vanilla sauce one of the best desserts I have ever had.  Diego was excellent Italian server, so fun and knew just what combination to serve us.  Don't miss this place!

tC6iaHkOqIxXb6qaGEGfIg.text: Cane here twice on my trip to Arizona and was so impressed both times! The people whp qork there are so nice and ALWAYS on top of everything. I never had to ask for more water, they saw it low and immediately came over to refill.  The bread was also great and they bring oil and vinegar and butter. The first time I went I started with their meatball appetizer. I highly suggest getting this (it is an Italian place but they do not believe I'm spaghetti and meatballs) then I had the sea bass as my mail course which was good but a bit dry. It came with some vegetables which were so good.  The second time I had the gnocchi with gorgonzola and walnuts except I asked them to add a bit of red sauce to it. That was SO DELICIOUS. I was so happy that they were so willing to change up their menu to accommodate my needs.   Parking: when I went there was a lot of parking all around (it is in a strip mall so there is a lot of parking)

hRSoPYF57f69hmLTOaJtQQ.text: The waitstaff (Joseph in our case) knows their menu and made spot on recommendations. Homemade pasta was quite well made. I had the braised duck ragout which was light but flavorful and filling. My hubs had gorgonzola gnocchi and oh boy that was some perfectly done fluffy but chewy pillows of amazingness. Joseph made a great wine recommendation based on what I like. They have made a really love closed off outside seating area that made a nice date night. Well done!

gvbM5P2RuCmLZER-GGBqpQ.text: The patio was great and the server was nice. The food was so bland and expensive for what I got. I ordered the seafood papardelle pasta special. It was a pile of dry noodles on top of a little flavorless olive oil with a few shrimp and small amount of crab for $26. So disappointing.

YgmAnumQxMifskA42ZViNw.text: Hadn't been to this place before. I'm used to homemade Italian food so my expectations are high. There were five of us and the place was busy. I ordered lasagna; the sauce was okay but tended to resemble something like that of chef boy aredee . My daughter had gnocchi and it was utterly disgusting. The sauce was so bland I could barely eat it. My wife ordered lemon chicken and it was okay; how can you mess up chicken. Our friends ordered fish and said it was terrible. The fish tasted really fishy and they left half of it over. The bread they served was okay but nothing special. I eat out every Friday and this a place I would never go near again. As for the other people eating, they must have dysfunctional stomachs and tas

d8rgrsSdVpSXo65kyh7tMQ.text: We wanted Italian and this place was delicious! The portions were just right and the flavor was very authentic! We had the pastas, and didn't have room for the meat plates. Coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lasagna and speck pasta with cream sauce

tRojDG9ivFB0IOdIhaFcVA.text: I made a last-minute reservation for Black Friday dinner with the family based on the yelp reviews. It was a nice short drive from the Scottsdale Fashion Square. This place made me want to go to Italy! What a great place to eat and rest, especially after a long day of deals and sales!  -Decor: Homey bistro-style interior. -Food: Pasta was really really good. We got calamari pasta (Tagliatelle Con Calamari), ear pasta with sausage and rapini (Orecchiette Salsiccia E Broccolini), Cornish hen (Galletto Alla Rustica), prosciutto pasta (Tagliatelle Tiroles), lasagna, and pork chop. I only tried the pasta dishes, and they were all heavenly delicious. I still have dreams about the spicy tomato sauce in the calamari pasta and the olive oil sauce in the sausage rapini pasta.  -Service: very attentive. Got my glass of water no ice filled incessantly throughout the meal.  I don't think I want every day to be a Black Friday, but I want every day to be a good pasta day in Veneto. I've never been so impressed with pasta! Will be back.

DutobjiNuujW5IPosywDlA.text: She-beaux's first cue that this joint was legit-- ordered the seafood special (similar to frutti di mare) and when my man brought out the food, did not bother to offer parmesan (because who would dare, right?!)  Keep in mind my love is a born and bred Eye-talian. She was (dramatic pause) very hyped on this anecdote.  Second clue: there were some ol' folks all over the joint speakin' in Italian, and I feel like when fools from the ol' country come out to patronize, it equates to realness.  The strip mall location threw me initially, but I'm still struggling to get a handle on the culture of Scottsdale. Food was fantastic, the mood was right, and the service was impeccable.  Notably (for this Yelper), the staff were able to carry on meaningful conversations that didn't invade our evening, but that also transcended the banal. Talkin' gluten-free and my man speakin' briefly about his autistic son and gluten-free experimentation was rad. It's this kind of thing that equates dining to an experience, not just a transaction.

Dv0srauTqzXlDufWEVqFFA.text: Have eaten here twice already and each time it was fantastic ... The fish is always fresh and the pasta is to die for.  The service is fantastic ... The space could use some updating. But comfortable  ... Oh and the drinks are strong and good  Lizzie

MRvRV_ITsQe95XZWi_l_tA.text: If I lived in Scottsdale, I would be among the regulars at Veneto Trattoria. We were surrounded by tables of folks who I had the feeling dined there with some regularity. Friends and families all enjoying great food and one another.  This place has a warm vibe and amazingly fast service--truly. I've never seen servers and bushops move so fast through a restaurant!   Sadly, we didn't have pasta--we were going to come back and try that, but never made it. But by all the plates going by us, I can imagine it's delicious.   We each had a fish dish: I had the bass special, and my wife had the swordfish. She orders swordfish whenever she gets the chance, and she said that that was probably the best--or at least among the best--that she had ever had.   We also shared the most incredible dessert. While every item on the menu sounded creative and interesting, we settled on the semifreddo al pistacchio. Oh. My. Goodness. So so good.   The dining room is really lovely. Warm lighting. Tables snuggled together, but not too close. It's divided into two rooms, and the outside seating area is nice, too, even though it's next to a parking lot. This is a lovely place for a nice date night with your honey, or to enjoy with a small group of friends or family.   We did not have a reservation, and the host was very kind to seat us. But I don't recommend just showing up. Make a reservation.

e8_wl7daw4Gn4_Up0Fhh6A.text: I have had lunch here at least ten times and dinner this evening.  The patio is open and perfect for this time of year. My wife had the prosciutto speck and pasta really good. Filling    I had the special sea food pasta. Excellent. The house chianti is excellent and the service Is always great the owner is on site often for lunch and dinner and makes sure everyone is happy. Medium priced got right in on a Saturday at seven. Highly recommended   If you order the specials they come fast so tell them to go slow if you want to linger  Michele was our waiter was terrific.

NpU_7e4LXi4t3GSVVnUnYw.text: +Authentic : decor all in Venetian style, servers and owner were Italian, the ambiance was very European  +Wait times; even on fairly busy evening for dinner, seated quickly and food arrived promptly  +Service : exceptional. Fast, polite, knowledgable, very accommodating  +menu : varied Choice, lots of changing chefs specials  + wine list : quite extensive   The food itself was excellent, very impressed with the quality of ingredients used - down to the olive oil and bread. Was very pleased with our choices, the Appetizers in particular were excellent. Next time might just try a sampling of these instead.   Overall an excellent choice, decor and service perfectly complement delicious Italian fare in a cosy setting. Sat inside but the Patio looked quite nice for a warmer evening. Will be returning

X5qVHbUye3E644E9rBdn8w.text: This was our first time here and went for lunch. The pasta was freshly made and flavors were exquisite. The service was an experience above and beyond and especially considering it was lunch time. Felt like I could sit and sip wine all afternoon. So comfortable and classy.

qrE1erKRr3fG35x-IBo8_A.text: I am torn in writing this review. On our first visit the food was outstanding. The pasta tasted very fresh and the salmon was cooked perfectly. We couldn't wait to come back.   We returned again a few weeks later and decided to order linguini with clams and veal ravioli. The linguini was OK, nothing special. The sauce was a bit watery and the clams were slightly overcooked. If this was the only issue we probably would still want to return and try again. However, the raviolis were dreadful. The veal was mushed up inside like cat food and they were so salty we could barely swallow them. It was an extremely disappointing meal. Now I am not sure if we will be able to give Veneto Trattoria another chance or not.

4oQh5iJd3ZrkMZNEsKofBQ.text: We were looking for a good Italian restaurant because our kids were craving pasta while on vacation here in scottsdale. We tried veneto and were overall unimpressed especially considering the prices. We don't mind paying close to $20 for good pasta but we felt what we got was pretty bland and not very fresh or authentic tasting (we are italian). My husband had the orrichiette and I had the pasta with eggplant. My husband requested hot oil or peppers but the only had the dry pepper flakes available (blech). Our kids just had plain spaghetti in a tomato sauce (they charged us 13.95 for each).   Service was ok but ambiance was setting was really dated.  There was a stale odour when we walked in. Maybe it was the carpet. The place is in need of a major Reno. The dim lighting must be hiding more wear on tear in the restaurant. I would not recommend this place or return.

fJ3S8rEqFL_plbBeSka8Nw.text: We lvoe Italian restaurants and are quite picky about them.   We discovered this gem as it is 2 blocks from our place.  It is in a strip mall, but that doesn't bother us a bit.  We've hit this place several times in a few days. I could eat there very night.  The homemade pasta is out of this world.  The pasta with speck and light cream sauce has a smoky flavor that is so good.  We had the scallops special with roasted red pepper sauce.  I don't like scallops but I tried it and loved it.  We've had the pork osso bucco - again, fabulous!  The gnocci with bolognese meat sauce is light and fluffy in a rich, complex tomato sauce.  Try the smoked carpaccio, it is different than normal carpaccio and absolutely delicious.  You absolutely can not go wrong at this place with anything you order.   The wine list is good - you can't go wrong with the Vietti or any of the italian wines they carry.  The patio is lovely and the service is incredible.  Wanda has been there for like 17 years and is Italian.  We had a great time conversing with her about Italy, the food, sights, etc.    You must try this place!

LT1UZ7gU6twEgcZhuMn-xg.text: Very good food & service. But with one big flaw. When you have been going to this rest., or for any other for a long time the owner should know you & at the least come over & say "glad to see you again. "Hope you enjoy your meal.." Too many places ignore their regulars at their peril. An old saying "take care of your customers or they will take care of you." Know what I mean?

4hj8kEiqxk4XG3BYA4ZkUA.text: Great food, attentive service. Diego & Elizabetta are extraordinary. This place makes you feel like family.

gpwJ7w3icXcaOKRHoZwyTA.text: The wife and I have been coming here since we moved to the Phoenix-Scottsdale area in 2014.  This place never disappoints, each dish is excellent and has a flavor of authentic Italian.  The service is always good, too, so this place has always stayed on the top of our list when we crave Italian.

7QsVV_bgYnG6frKWDKB_lw.text: In the mood for homemade pasta I looked up yelp and found this place. (Prior to looking at this place stumbled upon an Italian restaurant it looks like almost every single patron were of senior citizens, and the place is packed). That's when we decided to leave and come over here. This restaurant is perched in the plaza next to a Starbucks. This restaurant features a nice outside patio to dine at as well as the inside of the restaurant.  Unfortunately I was not able to take any pictures of the food that I ate because my phone died. We started off with some starter bread and butter and then the server came over and told us the specials of the day. Ordered the spaghetti alle Vongole with white sauce. Aka with clams. Also order the special of the day which is the pasta with seafood in a marinara sauce. Both dishes topped with grated Parmesan cheese!   The pasta tasted delicious and cooked al dente but some of the clams had some bits of sand or broken shells of some sort that I kept biting into and just was not as great of an experience. The other seafood dish filled with scallops, shrimp and topped with 2 huge mussels was also good except the mussels tasted too fishy and old. The server told us that the mussels came from the Mediterranean - which we are not sure how the shipping process was to get all the way here.   The brims of our water glasses were always filled to the top which to me is always fantastic and shows good service!

92APO9yyweZomqlddAmwbw.text: Had lunch at Veneto Trattoria today.  The outdoor seating was pleasant, but the food and service left a lot to be desired.  Wife had the chicken panini, which was undercooked (some of the chicken was still frozen), had huge chunks of tomatoes, and bland tasting.  Had the owner/manager come out who made an adjustment to the bill, but offered no apology and seemed largely put out.  The older mexican waitress was rude and curt.  Will not be back.

hhyLPdRwXYOvcFElpUyauQ.text: All I can say is "Wow"!!! Ask for Diego as your server! Such an awesome evening! Felt like we were back in Venezia!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!!! Ask for Diego as your server.

IsmKR_eqV4sW5C9G_ciqRw.text: Pretty interior. Friendly staff. The food was mediocre at best. I ordered the homemade ravioli. The sauce did not taste good at all. Almost soupy and looked like it came out of a can. For a place like this, I expected a bit more with quality. The flavors didn't mesh at all.. I couldn't taste the ravioli because the sauce over powered it. I am all Italian and was expecting a lot more than this. Will not be back.

RaoFsXJydBr3ocEdx2C9Mw.text: We had a really good lunch. I had lasagna, my friend had gnocchi in cream sauce with warm bread. We enjoyed our lunch on the patio with a light breeze. This was a perfect day for lunch out. Whether you want to call it Italian or not, we enjoyed our meal and had a good time. This was a nice treat. Our waiter LT was very attentive and made the afternoon even nicer.

pTyU5dVbSP8YwYFkTcchfA.text: If I could give this restaurant 6 stars, I would. I have been here twice now and I think this is one of the best restaurants in Arizona. Everything on the menu looks delicious and almost everything is made from scratch. I have tried several of the entrees and you can't go wrong no matter what you order. If you want a recommendation and love seafood, try the risotto dell adriatico. Also, you can ask the servers for recommendations because they are knowledgeable, friendly and know the customer favorites. Truly authentic Italian with great service.

xBn4vU0y7LkdgsR8FNL_vA.text: We only went here for dessert and tried a few different ones and they were all AMAZING!!! The pistachio was my all-time favorite but they were all  worthy   (went here a while ago but couldn't remember the name, finally sat down and figured it out and HAD to Yelp it because I want to go back AND share with others)

iYG10hbZwQQGrYTK78zRmA.text: Many years ago my husband and I "stumbled " on Veneto Trattoria and loved it. We returned often when in Scottsdale, but have not been in a few years.  While the restaurant has significantly expanded since our last visit, and was very busy,  the food was not as good as I remember.  Cod special was very tasty and cooked well, sauteed vegetables very good and well done, mashed potatoes were too salty and tasted more like box then home made.  Arugula salad special, was tasty but for a dinner portion salad at $10.95 overpriced.   Especially, when ordered with entree    Service left a lot to be desired.  Other than taking my order, my waitress was too busy chatting in Italian with a group of ladies celebrating a birthday.  She never returned to ask if I needed anything, my food was brought to me by support staff, dessert menu brought by the manager.    Not sure if I will return, as there are so many other great choices in this city.

an_w8fCvkeOu46DJoXwBaA.text: Just a really good experience.  Chef made carbonara for me and the dish was excellent.  Shared some wine and the most delicious melt in your mouth mozzarella I've ever had.  Loved the prosciutto but the mozzarella was phenomenal.  The experience was cool because Venetos is unpretentious.  It leaves you asking or wanting for nothing additional. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

aKgErnoQn3kalYVMaCXcew.text: My book club met here for lunch to talk about our latest book set in Italy and the initial impression was it was a fabulous choice. I loved the decor, the atmosphere and looking at the menu, I had the impression that the food would be delicious.   The bread was certainly delicious although it was served with butter and not olive oil. Regardless, the bread was still mouth watering. Especially the one with the sage & thyme flavor.   I think my friends enjoyed what they ordered- all the dishes looked delicious when the food came. All of them remarked how much they liked their house salads- esp. the tangy red wine vinegar salad dressing.   I had ordered the pork sausage on Savoy cabbage with polentas. When the dish came, the presentation looked great. 3 pieces of beautifully grilled polentas, 2 pork sausage links on a bed of Savoy cabbage. That is, until I took a bite of the dish!    It was soooooo salty that I felt like I was eating a salt lick!  I could feel my eyes bulge out it was so, so, so very salty.   I thought to myself: "wow, if I was a deer, I would be super happy just about now cause I felt like I had opened up a jar of salt and was pouring it into my mouth!!!    There might have been flavor to the dish but I couldn't taste anything but the salt cause . . . . It was soooo salty!!!  When I mentioned it to the waiter, he did not offer to take back the dish or offer compensation. He merely shrugged his shoulders.   One of my friends remarked how snubby he seemed which was a disappointment to me since I usually receive good service.   Another friend told me I should not have to pay for the meal if it was that bad. I still paid. Right now, 6 hours later even after 2 hours of playing tennis, my mouth still feels completely salty. You know the feeling.   So if you have high blood pressure or diabetes you should not order the pork sausage dish. If you are a deer in human disguise looking for a salt lick then by all means go for it!!!

pdpkU1GKXqx_6dFfhqU1yg.text: Arrived at 2:15pm on a rainy and chilly Saturday afternoon. We informed the hostess upon seating we were interested in coffee and dessert only. We were seated in the bar area with the front door propped open. I went to the ladies room and noticed the dining portion of the restaurant was much warmer. After looking around and noticing the restaurant was empty,I asked our server to be seated in the dining area. She gladly took us over there. A few minutes later she told us the owner will not allow us to sit in the dining area if we are only having coffee and dessert. Now mind you it's not dinner time and there was one other table occupied. I am not unreasonable and if it were the dinner rush hour I would have been compliant with the request. I felt at this point it was extremely rude and has lost our business today and in the future. I feel that all patrons count regardless of the total bill. The server was embarrassed and apologetic. This falls on the owner.

aAQCJ8AkdXnnZpt41w_3VQ.text: Great local spot. Excellent Italian food. Meatball appetizer was mother-in-law approved. The spaghetti and clam sauce. perfect. The lasagna bolognese sauce was bursting with flavor. And... they make awesome Cosmos!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front of restaurant

kWRO58PEHIsjHdKPm7e_gQ.text: After receiving -2- poorly cooked Veal T-Bones, The first I asked for Med-R and it came overcooked and dry nearly burnt, the 2nd attempt was seared Rare as Veal Sashimi... The owner came to my table and began to lecture me on how Veal can't be cooked between the 2 versions that I had been given! In fact the owner was rude, disrespectful, and angry.  He told me that I had no right to send back 2 steaks and that I should leave!    My friend and I completely shocked and speechless stood up and walked out.  I have been to this place a handful of times in the past and always had adequate experiences, but to be treated this way as a customer is disgusting and there is no excuse for this poor behavior.  What I will share with you is this restaurant caters to an older demographic of guests.  There are many regulars who visit this establishment, who are used to average food, below par service, and most likely don't know any better to distinguish from very average to a truly worthwhile dining experience.  The owner waltzes around bragging and telling stories of his past and of Italy... Some people may want to be in this kind of environment, however do not plan on going here if you want privacy as this place is very small and lacks the kind of romantic italian ambiance that one who hope for.    If you are looking for really good food save your time and money.  The food is average at best!  The prices are not some great value either.  The average entree price is just about $18, and apps/salads are each about $9 on avg.  Truthfully there are better places to eat in the valley and there should never an instance where a customer is treated so poorly by an owner.    Close your eyes and imagine seared rear meat-- I have had seared tuna sashimi that was more cooked than the steak that was brought to me.  This is inexcusable and poor execution.  Makes me wonder who they have working in their kitchen.  Pretty disappointing. Epic Fail!

nCNOUoxxnN0ZDEcEkiSxkQ.text: This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Arizona. I lived in Italy for a little, and this place is truly authentic. I've probably had their whole menu and fall more and more in love with each dish. If you're looking for the best Italian- go here!!

IfoEX84Ox_kugtkVdibZ_Q.text: My wife and I have been going to this restaurant whenever we visit Scottsdale now for over 10 years. We have always found the service friendly, helpful and reasonably quick. The food is prepared and presented well with dishes inspired from Northern Italy. They often have interesting specials each evening. Dress is usually business casual. Appetizers and dinner salads are very good. Some of my favorite entrees are osso buco, clams with linguine, and house prepared ravioli. Desserts are very good but a bit on the small side. My only complaint is that inside seating can become very noisy.  Because of this, I usually prefer to sit outside on their front patio with a gas heater lamp as necessary.

M041EsjZYdL1CjoOVIr71w.text: Food & Drink: Supberb Atmosphere: Excellent Service: Superior (Ask for Silvana) Notes: First time in 6 decades of Italian fine dining that I was charged $1.50 for Parmasan Cheese to be brought to the table. I spoke to owner, who was diplomatic/friendly regarding my questioning, and he stated that the cheese comes (gratis) with your meal grated onto your entree at delivery, but if you desire Parmasan Cheese (and olive oil) to go with your bread, THEN you pay.  Because, as he stated, it's the finest Parmasan cheese money can buy.  I'm Italaian and the cheese seemed no different than the Kraft Cheese you buy in the grocery store, lol. I still recommend when in Scottsdale.

O8RU-VlxvpaE1a31b1K2Rw.text: It never disappoints.  This is the first time that we sat outside and it was wonderful, it was a great night and it is a lot quieter outside then inside. The food was spectacular as always. Sorry for the short review but not much to say other then the food and service is nothing short of being the best.

9JCTGz984o251wh8KPlTGA.text: There is not a better Italian restaurant in the entire Phoenix metropolitan area.  Just basic Italian soul food with a staff that cares about pleasing the customer.  The chef always has some wonderful specials.

IuxwxIJHh3ROjug-mo63eA.text: We are Italians from Lake Como so we look for authentic Italian food every where we go.  To me the best Italian restaurant in Scottsdale is Andreoli followed by the pizza at Pomo.  The third best is Trattoria Veneto.  Order their pasta bolognese and you'll discover the subtlety of how real Italians prepare this dish.  They also do an excellent job of veal scallopini with porcini mushrooms.  The atmosphere is nice but not special or memorable.  We love the Italian lady who waits on us and Michele the owner from Treviso.  What I appreciate about this restaurant, Andreoli  and Pomo is that they haven't changed their cuisine to suit the American palette.  You get real Italian food at these three.

eovidL-idELYQnSP5tmWlg.text: Delicious!  Order the Risotto.    That's all I can really tell you because that's the only entree I've had here, but I haven't found a need to try anything else.  And that's big coming from me because I usually love to try different things.  But here I've found something so good (the Risotto) I don't want to try anything else, at least not yet and probably not for a long time.  Try it!  You will love the Risotto!

wPb5XhcmHG7kX9BqA7_WJA.text: This has authentic Italian cuisine.  I recommend this restaurant to customers if they want a great meal. The hostess Joanne always greets us with a friendly and welcoming attitude. Thanks for the great food and wonderful service!

T15bOJHX4MWCp90H9ArdVQ.text: Traditional North Italian fare served pleasantly but without imagination. This place won't wow, nor probably let you down. It is Red Sauce Central.   Veneto Trattoria has been here for ages and has a solid following of the older crowd and those who can't get into Houston's across the car park.

pbr8Yi4cINHGlSdISZ6hZQ.text: The food was delicious. I had the penne with chicken and prosciutto. It came with a nice cream sauce. I tried my date's gluten free pasta, and it was great. The only thing I didn't care for was the weird looks I was getting from the wait staff. It was unsettling.

vPlSk_qqSdAHfLaQj5Z-2w.text: nice lunch, very simple, high quality food served in perfect portions. ravioli's to die for, chef a master of tomatoes, today we had veal with morel's, small swatch of mashed pot's, and spinach. awesome. espresso, maybe some vino. b prepared for an older crowd, but in many cases crazy older folks not dead yet. village style cooking.

qxaaeTVmrN4m9PQZI3Sg9Q.text: Had dinner here last night, and it was really busy for a weeknight.   The wine, food, atmosphere, and staff were perfect. I am lucky to have such a gem of an Italian restaurant right in my backyard. We had the Salmon, Spinach Ravioli, and a "house recommended" glass of wine that we enjoyed so much we are ordering some online.

5Pd4XZ7UbdDipqVdQgLW0g.text: The atmosphere had a certain aire of the 1970s to it.  It was so dark in there everyone from age 22 to 83 had to read the menu by cellphone light.  This was ridiculous.  The waitress was rather abrupt.  Our salads were salty very nearly to the point of being inedible.  The entrees were uninspiring, neither bold nor subtle, just bland, and in the case of the cabbage, once again very salty.  Really, just go to the Olive Garden.

qC-cM-ZwWT1Y6Td_ovOrpA.text: Scottsdale, AZ-Most of the food was good. Most of the table got gnocchi with different sauces. Service was a little slower but overall a good experience. Would recommend this place for a nice dinner.

caayxoHAgP61pUFWR6EClQ.text: You've got to hand it to the Italians.  What they do love (food, cars, fashion, life) they do well.  This place embodies that impeccable love.  From the formal and attentive wait staff to the carefully selected old world influence menu, this place can almost make you forget that you are eating out of a strip mall.

k3HckOVIRDiMZU4NUd1XsQ.text: Cute place to bring a date. Our waiter was awesome he had a thick Italian accent ..it was a bit hard to understand when he told us about the specials but I thought that was pretty cool because it just adds to the whole experience you know? He recommended the  Portobello anitpasta, the Linguini with shrimp (with lemon zest) so good!!  & I believe it was the Linguini with ham (forgot the name of it). Everything was excellent and very tasty.  Went here on a weekend and it was pretty packed so make sure you make reservations!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Linguini with shrimp special of the day
Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Portobelo antipasta

stjA731Ofq5-kzymT6NqTA.text: Excellent ! A step into Italy. Cozy and elegant  atmosphere . We had amazing Lasagna and Spaghetti with claims. Highly recommend for a lovely night out.

uvbFDdHTrrPoN8rkuZjexQ.text: The very best pasta with sauces that are exquisite. On top of that, that ambiance is truly charming with Service that is marvelous.  We love this place.

HilGEf6YLKz5eamgqPqnjA.text: We were in town for Giants Spring Training and decided to eat here after reading the other yelpers' reviews.  We made same-day reservations and I gotta say, I was really looking forward to it.  We were seated immediately inside with a few other diners scattered around.  Our waiter, Pino greeted us with a friendly accent and brought our selected bottle of wine.  After a few minutes, we decided to split a mescalun and goat cheese salad and ordered our entrees - he: seafood liguine and me: spinach & ricotta ravioli, both in a light tomato sauce.  The salad arrives, it was good.  The goat cheese was soft & creamy and a nice touch.  Other diners arrive, more wine pouring by Pino, the clock is ticking and no entrees.  Our bottle is almost empty, others who arrived after us are now on their dessert and still we have no entrees.  After 40 minutes I asked Pino how much longer.  He says (holding up 3 fingers) "Three more minutes."  Uh-huh.  Ten minutes go by, I ask again.  He says "The seafood has to be cooked special. The sauce takes time.  If you wanted it sooner you should have told me when you placed your order to put it in right away."  What??? They were simple seafood pasta and ravioli dishes.  And I wanted my wine WITH my dinner, not as its own course.  If he was in the business as long as he said he was (20 years) he should know to feed diners the food and not BS.  Finally after an hour, we get our entrees.  Unfortunately, they were nothing special.  The raviolis were too al dente, mostly pasta with a small amount of filling and swimming in sauce.  His seafood linguine was decent, but no big deal.   The fastest thing in the restaurant are the busboys.  I swear it was like they were on roller skates.  Pino could learn a few things from those guys but I doubt his ego would permit it.

RjLskOTn9YpU3FY7UI4Udg.text: Don't know why I haven't written a review,; probably because I know how successful you are. You can always find couples and parties that are greeted as if they are family. The food is full of exploding flavors, and everyone is happy attentive and warm. Love this beautiful place. We have been for at least 10 years. Love Love Love

OOB0xY9YyQXvQ6P3fvURag.text: There are very few good memories of too long spent in AZ--caught in the real estate crash--but this restaurant is one of them.  Over a decade, Roberto and his team offered a broad menu with daily specials that consistently were high quality in a desert environment where shellfish and raw food items are both risky and expensive.  It was the ONLY Italian restaurant I visited who did not overcook the pasta, and had enough sense to offer 3 specials at lunch and 5 at dinner, a smart move for any restaurant that wants to maintain a steady clientele.

jVlMMxb9UrTVCi54fAyr-Q.text: We sat on the patio on a beautiful spring evening with a large group and the service was good enough, but the food was sooOo average, like so many Italian restaurants around here. It's quite frustrating actually. Actually, the tiramisu was quite good, and we did enjoy some grappa at the end of the meal.

QDBzAQuaivOaRRndjyYBPQ.text: Very typical Italian ambiance, excellent food, a better than average wine list. Be wary of the waiter than tells you that a second glass of Antinori Sangiovese  will give you a headache in the morning (such arrogance).  Made me wonder why the owner would include a wine on his menu that will give patrons a headache!

Jzfm2CmfcZ1Z6jpSSIE2Iw.text: Found on Yelp!  Craving Italian, we stopped in without a reservation pre-theatre and were seated immediately.  Server Wanda recommended the Pinot Bianco wine special on 1/2 price and it was superb!  We started with the salmon bruschetta and it was sublime.  I had the lasagna and my wife went for the whole wheat pasta caprese with tomatoes and mozzarella of course, and both were served with delicious Italian bread and butter.  This is the place to get your northern Italian on in Scottsdale!  Dining room full by the time we left so reservations recommended unless you go early like we did.

2KMq0-PFYjwHWfyBY4eA-g.text: This place is located in a strip mall and was actually packed with old people but we decided to stay since yelp said the food was so good. I did find it odd that this place didn't seem to have an official hostess stand so we were a little confused about who to ask for a table initially.  We were finally seated and the food was in fact pretty good. I had the orecchiette which didn't look amazing but tasted delicious. My boyfriend had some sort of shrimp stuffed pasta which he thought was just ok.   Overall, I'd say 3.5 stars. Prices were a little steep for the strip mall location and the food quality varied.   Side note: Since it was a strip mall I let my boyfriend just wear shorts and a Giants shirt. He ended up being underdressed -- but maybe thats because the old folks like to dress up?

WssOmzaxmzlfRTeF9Rplsg.text: Hands down the best italian restaurant in town! Exceptional  consist very friendly staff and service. Can not go wrong whether you sit inside or out, both very romantic, intimate, comfortable and Inviting. All their food ans especially pasta selections are made fresh and very light which I absolutely love. Diego is my favorite server :)

xCqw8x5hSO2cKRuAcrMq1A.text: I come here off and on. Well OK, to be honest this is my "Cheers" where I usually go and sit at the bar and enjoy outstanding wine, appetizers ( the BEST burrata) and great company. But tonight I came by, my bar seats were taken, so I sat at a table. The special tonight was a new beef dish made with a grass fed beef from a special breed of cows from the Piedmont area in Italy. The backstory here is that I usually prefer to eat a more Paleo oriented diet where livestock graze, fish are caught wild in the ocean, vegetables are growing in my organic garden, or I'm foraging food from the field.  Mind you, I get that most of the food I eat at my favorite Italian restaurant is not that. But I trust that the love that's put into the cooking in the wonderful olive oils used make it a blessing to my digestive tract. NOW, I have a new meal I can order here that fits my most preferred dietary formulas! This grass fed beef was amazingly tender and tasty. Cooked to perfection, flavor leaning on its own deliciousness, served with exactly the right combination of arugula salad and hard cheeses. Hoping they find a good source for wild caught salmon eventually... I will be even more devoted.  Please come and try it!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AK-ix1b4c4AN3WD43viQJQ.text: I got a piece of Tira Misu to go and it was almost ten dollars and it was the size of a credit card. What a rip off. Would not give these guys my business again.

eXcizLnFQqMAjTcTnGbfNA.text: That moment when you sit down in a lovely little restaurant and realize that you've struck Italian food GOLD...  We stopped by after one of our 2 hour walks one afternoon. First, the restaurant is beautifully appointed. It felt like stepping into a family restaurant in Italy. The menu had wonderful selections and being the first time we found several options that made a single selection difficult.   The waiter was wonderful, very helpful and made useful suggestions including the day's specials. My wife immediately decided on the special and I tried a spinach pasta with a light mushroom and ham cream sauce.   Delicious, light, and absolutely enjoyable meal.   Proud that we managed to avoid licking the plates, we were still compelled to order a meal to go. We know we will return soon and embark on a determined mission of conquest over the rest of the menu. Go soon, relax and enjoy a visit to Italy without the 12 hour flight.

lOOYMhamXKO7RO-D4c6ERw.text: Buonissimo! Excellent place for an authentic Italian experience. My friend and I had lunch here, we were both curious about their pasta and their sauces. We started with a house salad (perfect size to share), and I have to say the white vinegar aftertaste worked magic. Lasagna was good, but not the best (maybe a little more besciamella next time), orecchiette with sausage and rapini was AMAZING!! Al dente, sauce not too heavy, we both loved it. Our waiter, Lauren, took great care of us. We'll be back for more pasta and wine!!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lasagna, orecchiette and vino!!!!

cGeaihoSZHIEiMnO_jFQBQ.text: We are not regular customers of this restaurant since we are in Scottsdale only two or three months most years.  However, when at our place, we make a point of dining here.  We like it a lot and recommend it to others.  When we met friends for dinner recently, we discussed alternatives and i swayed the group toward this normally fine restaurant.   We were seated immediately.  The restaurant was very busy but there seemed to be plenty of staff.  I should have gotten nervous when after greeting us, our waitress took more than 15 minutes to return.  We saw her infrequently.  Food and beverages were generally delivered by others though she took the order.  I ordered squid ink pasta with calamari.  It is a dish I love and often order when I see it. I hadn't seen it on this restaurant's menu before. I also ordered a salad.  The salad was not good which might be blamed on the romaine crisis that week.  The pasta was unlike any squid ink pasta I had seen before, in the US or Italy. It was light pasta with streaks of black.  The calamari was difficult to eat.  I know it is often tough but I had difficulty piercing pieces with a fork.  My wife ordered ravioli and it was barely warm when she got it but it tasted good.  Why didn't we complain?  Our food was delivered by others and we didn't see our waitress for quite a while.  We will return when in town.  I hope this was a one time problem caused by the stress of a full house.  Next time the restaurant is really busy, I think I will have to make a decision about staying or going elsewhere.  Up to now, our experiences have been great when dining here.

Xs7NoWFFJ8N8V6hTlWbNDQ.text: Wow! What a great surprise! We made a reservation at this restaurant since it was across the street from where my parents were staying. The atmosphere was very comfortable and cozy, white tablecloths and not too loud; we could actually carry on a conversation! Our server, Joseph, was so professional (and Italian?), never wrote anything down but got each order exactly correct. Each of us (4) ordered a different item from the menu and we each LOVED our dish. Sometimes Italian place have a "white" or "red" sauce that goes on everything - not here! Each of our dishes had a special sauce that was unique and superb! Bread was awesome, salad was crisp and fresh, tiramisu was fantastic! Go here!!

R2LCkg56NKzTrX-Lk7lM6g.text: Nice atmosphere. Was totally unimpressed with the food.  Okay nothing special. Thought it was overpriced and waiter just cared about turning the table.  Barely got our drinks and he was wanting our order.  Told him not ready and he cane back within 5 minutes.  Won't be back

TqTkS1vkmMN86KP7uZyLIQ.text: So we went here on a Saturday with 2 friends for lunch, they close or their website said they close from 2:30 - 5:30, we got there about 1:40pm and it was not crowdes at all. Upon original contact the staff was friendly but not very attentive for as slow as it was. My iced tea glass sat empty(in plain view on the end of the table)  for half the meal and at least  15 minutes after We all were finished, and the table was cleared, so I am a little dumbfounded by all the attentive service comments.  That said, let's talk about the food. The bread they brought before the meal was very good but the basket sat empty after our entrees were delivered. I ordered lasagna and my friend had a pasta seafood which smelled. And looked good, but the lasagna was a different story, I would say it was good, not great, fantastic or outstanding...in my opinion, the lasagna at Casella's Deli (which is just about 2 miles away) is much better (and in my opinion the service was 100 times better).    To sum it up, I was not impressed, in my opinion, there are better places, but it was not awful and it was not 5star either. I guess it depends on your personal preferences.

CYfHlZfkEcejAdu-C_qxPg.text: Terrible service, If you don't have reservations and just walk in. the hostess in her 60s with dark medium hair with tons of cosmetic surgery just forgets your there and sits other people first, can't tell you about the food, we sat for over a half hour with my 82 year old Mom in metal cold chairs. No one offered a drink and we had to leave my Mom was hungry. Would not recommend We were treated poorly and there were empty tables we could have sat at in the outside area and the inside as long as we waited we could have eaten and left. We felt unwanted, non important and will not return if your not their coveted VIP customer your crap to them.

dYQ73KB_ohtX1cMpvQ-7Mg.text: I'm not from the area and everything seems to close somewhat early around here. Veneto Trattoria was one of the few places open until 10:00pm with 4 stars so it wasn't a hard choice.   Thankfully this place ended up being very memorable for the food and the service.   I never order seafood soups but the way the server described this special appetizer, it sounded great so I got it and it was AMAZING! It had one clam, one mussel, one scallop (good size), one piece of halibut, and one piece of salmon (it also came with one piece of shrimp but I eliminated it because I am allergic) and it was in a light red broth. It may have been the best soup I've ever had.  For the entree I got the lasagna, my special lady got whole wheat pasta with mozzarella and tomato in an amazing tomato sauce called a 'Capris Pasta' or something similar. My son got a basic spaghetti that turned out to be not so basic because the sauce was simply incredible.   We went in not expecting much at all, 8:45pm, somewhat last minute with little planning and this turned out to be one of the best meals on our trip.   Beyond that, the service was perfect. The staff were absolute professionals in every sense of the word.   I highly recommend Veneto Trattoria.

9xMvMlDzDbZ18TEkUw_bBg.text: The setting is beautiful and the staff was very impressive however I did not like my dish/meal. I had the special rib eye which was just tasteless and had lots of gristle in it. My friends did enjoy their dish but I'm not sure what they ordered.

Rp3l9fEaJZ9PXCKlTKqY6A.text: Revisited this lovely place after several years and it is still as good as it gets. I had the homemade ravioli with mushroom sauce and it was delicious.  The Crema Cotta for dessert was light and mild and piled with ripe fresh fruit.  I highly recommend, good value, real food.

a6667xeasvO2NzdqLhilFg.text: Wanted to find an amazing Italian restaurant and we hit the spot! This place is hard to find in a strip mall but it's very homey and romantic. The service is impeccable. He was even recommending lots of half and half choices!!   We had the two vegetarian soups with pumpkin lentil and vegetarian vegetable soup. Then had the carpaccio and the seared scallops as the special appetizer.   For dinner we had the sea bass, seafood pasta, shrimp angolotti, and orchietta. Then the vegetarian dad got to try the half and half vegetarian pasta! So amazing!   Could not believe how good the food is here for an Italian restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half and half plates with shrimp ravioli and orchietta sausage!
Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Seafood pasta!!! This is amazing!! The salmon, scallops, the mussels, shrimp, and fish was so fresh and not dry!!
Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beef carpaccio

gEAoqlf8YFik7vPozurBQw.text: In a word: Fantastic.  We were visiting from out of town but noted it is not a tourist spot by the number of obvious locals who came in and knew the staff and vice-versa.  A busy non-tourist spot is always a good sign that we picked a great place, and we were not disappointed.  My wife had a basic lasagna bolognese, a good bellwether dish and she could not have been more impressed.  I opted for one of the specials of the night, a beef filet with a cremini mushroom cream sauce over polenta.  The filet was cooked perfectly, the sauce was light, and the polenta creamy and delicious.  The service from our waiter was spot on, and a bottle of 2010 Michael Chiarello Barolo was a perfect match for the meal.  They have a relatively short, but complete wine list, so we had no problem picking a great wine.  We finished our meal with a coffee drink and cognac...a terrific end to a wonderful dinner.  The next time we are in Scottsdale, we will most certainly visit again!

rmzkfUBxAKjLJgFm9X4HGQ.text: Came here with a group of 10 and many of us didn't think the food had any flavor.  The service was also very mediocre.   We waited a long time to order and even longer to get the check.  Much better options in the area

8LoOuDOMRJeVhcdqqOS_BQ.text: We stopped in here the other night on the combination of a whim and the mention of their wine list from a friend who is in the restaurant business.  We've been here before but it's literally been many years.  Now we wonder why we didn't put Veneto on our restaurant rotation.  It is now!  We started with the Insalata d'arugula e radicchio and the Carpaccio Affumicato.  The salad had almonds and great parmesan and we were taken with the smokey flavor of the beef.   The atmosphere called for pasta so we each picked one.  Peg had the Fettuccine  with duck ragout and I had the Veal and Mushroom Ravioli.  We shared of course and both of us loved both of them.  We splurged on dessert on our server's recommendation and the Semifreddo al Pistacchio was the perfect ending to a delightful romantic meal.  The service was just impeccable. We loved every single minute and every single bite.  We can't wait to repeat the experience.

VulPPvX_4L_F7IT7l-8btQ.text: Talks like a duck, walks like a duck but sure the hell IS NOT A DUCK, this place is about as italian as hungry howies pizza!!! Bland and tasteless!!! Waste of time and money!!! No chef behind in that kitchen!!! Bad, bad, bad!

Xk8l3ZqA8SVvqyfL7qC_Nw.text: I can't say enough about this Italian restaurant as they are every consistent! The food is fresh and quality, perfectly seasoned and well prepared! There desserts are also to die for and if your a coffee drinker and haven't tried their expresso drinks your missing out!

E6qIkBULzfbxG1pB--WPJw.text: My husband and I eat here at least twice a week.  The Minestrone is amazing, it is our favorite.  Some of our other favorites are the Brick Chicken, which is sometimes a special and the filet.  Our favorite server, Silvana, is the best!  She is one of the reasons we come back to this restaurant.    Everything on the menu is good.  The owner, while pleasant, seems to only be friendly with customers he has known for years.  He also needs to engage with new customers.

Ohun7kgToUT8s7MNHCnHvg.text: This place was amazing. Not only was the food great, but the customer service and atmosphere were superb. I highly recommend this place. The lasagna alla bolognese is what I got and it was so good. My other family members also got the gnocchi and a steak and they really enjoyed it.

i_DyrGQ8RmTMVWR0UDXLlg.text: Food and service are always top shelf at this long time Scottsdale favorite. If you're lucky enough to go on a night they feature the lemon shrimp with homemade pasta, don't fail to order it.

zSiQ1lztK6Oo5TCfLzmEpA.text: I went here for dinner a couple weekends ago, and it was just OK.  My food, the swordfish special, lacked flavor.  The 2 appetizers we got, a burrata plate and charcuterie were both really good.  The service was attentive.  I tried some of the other dishes, and I just wasn't super in to the Venetian food.  My family, however, really liked their meals.  I'll chock my opinion up to preferring food from other regions of Italy because everything else was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Swordfish special. It was just OK.

e1IIOj-3b1g2OtK6ag-7Tg.text: This place was amazing. They made a special order veal dish with a side of ravioli that reminded me of my home made dishes from home. The service was impeccable.

PLApLRZHz0ycJWQSlxuGlg.text: Had not eaten here in several years. Past experiences were good. This time I found my entree to be mediocre. Ordered tiramisu for dessert and both my wife and I said it was tasteless. Tasted like a stale piece of angel food cake. We complained to the waiter and he removed the plate. When the bill came the charge for the tiramisu was included. I asked the waiter why this was so and he said the owner did not offer refunds. I asked to speak to the owner and he came over and was clearly combative. I asked why he would charge a customer for a dish that was returned. He said there was nothing he would do. I said he was not a very good businessman who would risk losing a customer who was paying $90 for dinner over a $8.50 desert. His answer was "I don't care".

usdcyYBEgg2u8SwR6eOhBQ.text: Great spot for a date, great spot for a family dinner. It's felt like family joining family. The menu is more Venetian than typical Italian, so be ready for more seafood.  We had a great bottle of wine, carpaccio, ravioli and risotto l, all delicious.  Only reason it's not a 5...Service was super friendly and helpful, they could have been a tad bit more helpful, but it's a packed house, we get it.

tNP-5WqNIsaSMn-mPpu_4w.text: Everything and I mean EVERYTHING on the menu is to DIE for! Authentic Italian food right in Scottsdale! The owners Roberto and Susan are absolutely wonderful!!! The service is incredible! I definitely recommend reserving a table on their romantic patio!! The Lasagna, Gnocchi, all of their chicken dishes are sooooo delicious! Perfect for special occasions and smaller parties!

DVjQ5uEIlqa6kQ0XLj8Ssg.text: I've only had Ciopino and minestrone and both were excellent. Especially the Ciopino which I've had 3 times. It's very light and more of a white wine base with a light touch of tomato. The biggest compliment I can give them is that they completely changed my Ciopino game. I've only had a heavier more tomato based version and there's is so much better. They are extremely generous with the seafood and it is excellent quality. The shrimp is whole and head on like it is everywhere in Europe. Highly recommended.

0DJAzaWAVrd37Hs0gDVy2A.text: Family owned, homemade, higher end, beautiful restaurant! Starting with the bread that comes right out fresh, great crust and whipped butter. Ask for toasted bread before your food arrives, it's the bomb! I had the mozzarella / prosciutto panini! It was fabulous. My colleague had the Spec pasta, spec is cooked prosciutto tossed in pasta with a light cream sauce. Very tasty. Dessert was great glass of limoncello with biscottis.... go, enjoy and indulge

iVmge-FWGknU-VneqKBSBg.text: A nice Italian place in a strip mall near the Hilton on Scottsdale road. It has a smaller seating area. They have a really good wine menu and good deals if you're buying a bottle.  I ordered a glass of red Italian wine, but I can't remember the name. $10.00 a glass and it was good.   For dinner I ordered gnocchi with cream sauce and walnuts. I requested the wait staff add in some chicken, but she said she couldn't do that. For that alone they get one star reduction. They don't seem to be flexible with their clients and that's unacceptable.  Fresh bread was provided. No oil for dipping. There was a bit of garlic butter though.   Dessert was ice cream with scotch, cappuccino, chocolate chips, and whipped cream. Very good.   Water glass was mostly full all the time.  Service was so so. The guy filling my water glass was the friendliest help there.   They need to work harder for my service.

photos.caption: Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dessert
Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gnocchi
Photo of Veneto Trattoria - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Almost empty water glass.

u7vcxnrXRa1N-M5mPkpzgQ.text: This is the second time I have eaten at Veneto Trattoria.  This time we ordered from their Valentine's day pre-fixe menu.  Normally I don't eat dessert because I am full after my meal, but because it was part of the menu, I ordered the Tiramisu.  It was fabulous!  You must try it there!  I ordered the Veal Scallopini and my husband the Seafood dish.  They were both excellent!  I have to give credit to our waitress as well.  Because of the rain, they had to move  some tables in from outside.  Our waitress was attentive and efficient with all the confusion in the cramped space.  Such a great Italian restaurant!  We will be going back!

jzd9I9AeFG7T65hZRao5kg.text: Disappointing experience. Eight of us went to celebrate a birthday. Service was very poor despite not being busy and most food mediocre. Three at our table ordered the lasagna, it looked like a soupy mess on the plate when served. Salmon salad good except salmon very over cooked. Wouldn't choose to return.

saUSlQL89de3J45ZgFZ9YA.text: I loved everything they served me. Eggplant gratin,Meat ball,And the lasagna. The flowerless chocolate cake was also very delicious. I was  very pleased and I'm  hard to please.  I also feel like the pricing is  extremely  reasonable. I was shocked  at all the food we got and  how low the check was. I will be letting family and friends about this  place. I really loved it.

ZF_QS2wPdHP7bPVNQzQ9iA.text: Bellissima Esperienza!!! What an incredible experience! We live a short distance from this restaurant, and tonight was our first visit. My only wish is that we would have eaten here years ago.  Tonight's staff has been working like a perfect ensemble. When we arrived, the hostess directed us immediately to our table. Our server is very down-to-earth and direct with her answers, and the food is amazing! We have traveled to Italy many times, and the food is definitely on par (if not better) than several authentic Italian eatery. We ate the short rib special, Cornish hen and lemon chicken, which were all flavorful. But, I must admit, what made me incredibly impressed, was simply the fact that the staff made sure our water glasses were never depleted! We will most definitely return, and I highly recommend this establishment.

vXIBm7OcKLo5pEkZeXalUQ.text: The atmosphere of this restaurant is very pleasant, and the staff are always gracious. However, the food  tastes uninspired, and lacks most flavour other than salt. This might be expected of someplace like Sbarro or Olive Garden, but for a restaurant that positions itself as upscale, I think this is unforgivable.

FzcVLF7p8pADdupsXgoi8Q.text: I went there the other evening to celebrate a friend's birthday bash.   What a busy night!   There were probably 8-10 of us.   We had reservations and got seated right away.   It did take quite a looong time to get our drinks, and a much looonnnger time to have our orders taken.   Good thing we all had things to talk about!  I ordered one of the specials of the evening:   linguine with shrimp in lemon cream sauce.   It was quite tasty albeit I wouldn't mind if the pasta could be cooked a bit less so it doesn't stick together.  Just my taste preference, I guess.   It was plenty creamy -- I did have added grated cheese, though, since I like cheese -- and the shrimp was cooked to perfection.     The people I talked to said their food was good.   I didn't try any of it, and it was too noisy to carry on a conversation let alone ask what they all thought of their food.  I will give the food four stars but the wait time would have kicked it back to three.   If I go again, and the wait time is still very looonnng, I will give it three and probably not return.   I'm not kidding.  It was soooo long that we were all watching for the server to make sure we could snag her before she could disappear into the unknown.

sW_jh_QUPYibOcF5qsl98g.text: We enjoyed the ambiance however it was a little too dark at night. The food was excellent for me and my two kids. They split the Lasagna without a fee despite the cost listed in the Menu. Food was great and the Bread was very good too!

Dm5W41NDRGLISPKr0a_Z9w.text: Veneto Trattoria is a must go to restaurant in my opinion. Reservations are a must. Dinner was wonderful! We had a party of four for dinner. We all were raving about our meals. I did see a table setup for six, I felt that could be a little tight. We will most definitely be going back again. The wait staff was great.

wh1uAhE2QJhHNaxpzrx85w.text: Diego was awesome and helped us order some delicious vegetarian dishes. The tiramisu and espresso were amazing as well.
